memo:
BILL NUMBER:S2639

TITLE OF BILL:
An act
to amend the real property tax law, in relation to authorizing certain
state lands to taxation for school purposes in the county of Suffolk

PURPOSE:
Relates to authorizing certain state lands to taxation for school
purposes in the county of Suffolk.

SUMMARY OF PROVISIONS:
Paragraph (f) of subdivision 1 of section 536 of the real properiy tax
law, as added by section 1 of part W of chapter 62 of the laws of
2006, is amended.

JUSTIFICATION:
Under current law, the Riverhead Central School District receives
Payments in Lieu of Taxes (PILOT) for state owned lands with the
Southampton Town portion of the Central Pine Barrens Core
Preservation Area and also all state owned lands Within the Riverhead
Town portion. This bill would require New York State to make PILOT
payments to the Riverhead Central School District for all state owned
lands in the Southampton Town portion of the Riverhead School
District. It is not anticipated that this legislation will require a
substantial appropriation from the State since a bulk of the district
is within the Core Preservation Area of the Central Pine Barrens, an
already receiving PILOT payments.

LEGISLATIVE HISTORY:
2009-10: S.796
2007-08: S.7008

FISCAL IMPLICATIONS:
To be determined.

EFFECTIVE DATE:
This act shall take effect immediately and such payments shall apply
to the school year commencing July 1, 2011.
